title.en: English. General Academic Vocabulary (100% Web-Based), B1.2 > B2.1
title.et: Inglise keel. Üldakadeemiline sõnavara (100% e-õpe), B1.2 > B2.1

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
During the course, students will do a series of interactive exercises, participate in forum discussions and sit two 50-item vocabulary tests.
The topics covered during the term are: word classes, word families and word parts (prefixes, suffixes and roots), collocations (adjective + noun, verb + noun, dependent prepositions, prepositional phrases) word grammar (reporting verbs,  noun patterns, verb patterns, adjective patterns), confusing words (e.g. lie vs lay), foreign plurals, functions (organising the writing; introduction, summary and conclusion; cause and effect; classifying; comparing and contrasting; describing change, degrees of certainty).
description.et:
Kursuse jooksul teevad üliõpilased interaktiivseid veebipõhiseid sõnavaraharjutusi, osalevad foorumiaruteludes ning sooritavad kaks veebpõhist sõnavaratesti.
Teemadeks on sõnaliigid, -perekonnad ja -osad (prefiksid, sufiksid ja tüved), kollokatsioonid, sõnagrammatika, segadusttekitavad sõnad (nt lie vs lay), võõrmitmus, funktsioonid (sissejuhatus, kokkuvõte, põhjus ja tagajärg, klassifitseerimine, võrdlus, muutused, modaalsus).

objectives.en: The course aims to expand students' academic vocabulary and to help them to acquire a more reflective way of vocabulary learning.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on laiendada üliõpilaste akadeemilist sõnavara ja aidata neil teadlikumalt sõnavara omandamisele läheneda.

notes.et:
By registering for this course students accept the course requirements and policies.
If students hand in plagiarised work, they will be removed from the course and their result will be "F".
The news and course information will be in Moodle.
NB! Each test can be sat only twice. No test can be sat thrice.

independent_work.et: Warm up, forum discussion (two entries), database entry (250 words) + two comments

description.et: The warm-up exercise is completed according to the instructions.
During the forum discussion, students write at least two 120-150 word posts on a given topic and use seven items of vocabulary learned during the first part of the course.
Test 1 (61% of the points for a positive result)
Test 2 (51% of the points for a positive result) Forum, database and tests are open again from May 22 to Jun 16/18.

grade_preconditions.et: All elements (the warm up, the forum discussion, Test 1, Test 2 and the entry+comments) need to be completed with a positive result to get the final grade! If anything is missing the grade will be "F". NB! Each test can be sat only twice. No test can be sat thrice.

grade_evaluation.et: Warm up, forum discussion, Test 1, Test 2 and the entry + comments - if all the elements are completed by the deadline, you will get a positive grade for the course.

description.et: Orientation. Word classes
Collocations I: introduction
Word analysis I
Presenting an argument and Organising your writing, ic/ical adjectives deadline for warm-up exercise
Word analysis II, foreign plural
Cause and effect. Comparing and Contrasting
Summary and conclusion
Revision. TEST 1
Collocations II: fixed expressions and prepositional phrases Deadline: forum discussion Choose the topic of the database entry by May 15
Referring and reporting
Hedging and degrees of certainty, problematic verbs and nouns
Classifying and change
Introduction into word grammar
Collocations III: dependent prepositions
Revision. TEST 2 deadline for database entry

The forum and the database are open until Jun 16.
Resitting tests until Jun18.
